sense.name: render one language in another language; express or transform in a new language
sense.examples: We were asked to translate a list of sentences. She works for the EU, translating from English into French. How does it translate the program into machine code? Occasionally, I translated French and German poems. Here are three poems in English, but most poetry doesn't translate well. The idiom doesn't translate well. So how does this theory translate into practical policy? Braque translated collage into oil. What I held back was too sacred and personal to translate into words. Not everything we learned in college translates well to the world of business. Today's steady growth in household income translates into more purchasing power.

sense.name: transfer to a place or into a state
sense.examples: She was translated from her small country home to a high-rise city apartment. Oh, the sweetness of being translated into a state of complete purity and perfection!

sense.name: say or interpret something in understandable terms
sense.examples: Can you translate the instructions in this manual for a layman? Is there a need to translate the psychiatrist's remarks? I translated his silence as approval. You'll have to translate the attendant's vague mumbling for us.

sense.name: PHYSICS-move a body sideways through space in a stright line without rotation
sense.examples: Thirdly, the rotated object is translated to the new target position. The target is then translated to desired position and orientation.

sense.name: BIOLOGY-determine amino acid sequence during a protein synthesis
sense.examples: This service transcribes DNA into mRNA and translates mRNA into Amino Acid sequences. The information carried by the DNA bases translates into proteins.
